DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Gathering information patient terminal metastatic cancer may help doctor learn effectiveness nurse practitioner hospice program . It yet know whether nurse practitioner program help increase patient ' length stay hospice . PURPOSE : This randomize research study evaluate nurse practitioner hospice program patient terminal metastatic cancer family caregiver .
DOC.brief_title: Nurse Practitioner Hospice Program Patients With Terminal Metastatic Cancer Their Families Caregivers
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : Primary - To assess effect palliative advance registered nurse practitioner liaison program ( PAL ) length patient 's enrollment hospice care . Secondary - To evaluate impact PAL program patient 's knowledge hospice service . - To evaluate impact PAL program patient family caregiver 's psychological stress palliative treatment . OUTLINE : Patients randomize 1 2 arm . - Arm I ( advanced register nurse practitioner [ ARNP ] intervention ) : Patients family caregiver receive information ARNP terminal cancer , resource available supportive care , benefit palliative care . After transition hospice , patient receive pain palliative medicine , psychology , social service , chaplaincy , patient support group intervention arrange ARNP . Patients complete Patient Questionnaire overall quality life mental , emotional , physical well baseline 3 week intervention time enrollment hospice . Patients family caregiver contact ARNP weekly . - Arm II ( ARNP intervention ) : Patients family caregiver complete Patient Questionnaire , administer clinical research assistant ( CRA ) , Arm I . Patients family caregiver receive ARNP intervention . After transition hospice , patient receive routine hospice care . Patients participate study duration 21 day hospice care . At completion study , patient arm complete questionnaire pain management , social , emotional , spiritual mental well-being . Patients ' family caregiver complete Caregiver Questionnaire Hospice Family Satisfaction Survey 3 week patient 's death .
